captions.text:
- I have been broken up
with a couple of times.
- Lots of times.
- I have never been broken up with.
- I have been broken up with.
- I have been broken up with.

- No, yeah, I've been totally
(laughs) broken up with.

I think most of the times
I've done the breaking up,
but this last one, I got broken up with,
and it was really devastating.

BuzzFeed presents Women
Talk about Heartbreak
What's the worst way you've been dumped?

- I was pretty convinced
this guy and I were dating,
and then he told a mutual friend of ours
that we were just friends and he was sorry
I misunderstood the situation,
and he never talked to me about that.
- So he was driving from New York,
preparing to break up with me,

and I was lighting
candles in the hotel room
and filling the tub with bubble bath
and buying his favorite beer,
so we both had very different ideas
of how that night was going to end.

We both had to stay in
that hotel that night
after he broke up with me.

- We were together for
four and a half years
and he broke up with me over the phone.

- The shittiest way someone
has broken up with me

is by showing up on a red
carpet with another girl.
Yep.

What's the worst way
you have dumped someone?

- I didn't make it clear that
I was breaking up with him,
so I told him that I wanted to slow down
and to take a step back to being friends,

and I thought that he
knew what that meant,
and then, a week or two later,
he was like, "You want to be done dating.

"I wish you'd just said
that," and it was really bad.
- This one time I was talking on the phone

with a boyfriend, and he
was telling me (laughs)

he just got a power drill
and he kept whirring it

in the background, and
at some point I said,

"If you do that one more
time, I'm hanging up

"and I'm never speaking to
you again," and he did it,

and I (laughs) hung up
and that was our breakup.

I refused to talk to
him (laughs) ever again.
- I basically was running after him,

and he thought that I
wanted to get back with him,
and instead, I broke up with him,

and I took the keys to
my apartment from him,
and it was really bad.

I think he was in a bad
situation in his life,
and I dumped him at his worst,

and I think for him, it was
like everything was crumbling

and the last thing that
was going to fall was me.

How do you know when a
relationship should end?

- When they can't laugh
when things go wrong,

and I know that not all situations
when things are going bad

can you laugh at, but I
think that it's a sign

when instead of finding a
way to kind of bond together

against whatever the bad
thing is that happened,
you turn on each other.
- You stop getting excited to see them,
and that's kind of when you know
you're really not interested.
- It's very intangible,
but when somebody just doesn't like you
for you anymore, it's over.
- I think it's really hard.

I mean you just see a person
that you're really close to

and you love, and you
try to overlook a lot

of things all the time,
and I don't really know.
I don't really know.
Music: Welcome
Warner / Chappell Production Music
Breakups
Guys talk Heartbreak

comments.text: Oh my.. i think im in love with the puple hair girl <3﻿
comments.author: andrew tezyano

comments.text:
For women, a breakup is like a cut: it hurts straightaway, but gets better. 
For us, a breakup is like poison: at first you don't feel a thing, but 
later you just don't feel right, and then it builds up and hits you when it 
breaks out.﻿
comments.author: chillchillpill

comments.text:
My fiancee blocked me on Facebook on my birthday, then gave his friend a 
list of things he wanted back from me. This was 3 months before our wedding 
date. The invitations had gone out, and the bridal shower had just 
happened. After prodding he spoke with me in person. Had a lot of reasons 
that amounted to cold feet. After being with him for almost 7 years, and 
having them do this to me, I'm not sure how I will be able to trust again.﻿

comments.text:
When I broke up w/my boyfriend it was January and he is a natural flirt 
w/every girl and I felt like he was drifting off in the relationship and 
not staying in so I broke up w/him but what I didn't know till later was 
that he bought me a really expensive gift for valentines day a couple days 
before I broke it off.
I felt horrible because of that and the fact that I said "I think we need 
to take a break" and he knew what that meant. 
He's now just a friend but he still likes me but is trying to get over it.
What really sucks is that I think I'm starting to fall for my best friend 
who I think broke up with his girlfriend but has an eye on another girl.
And one of his best friends is of course my ex...
My ex thought we were dating and got angry but got relieved when he found 
out we weren't.
I still like my best friend
He is a couple months younger than me by I don't care we are the same age 
right now anyways
He's my homie, my best friend, and my crush.
I don't know what to do.
﻿

comments.author: Zander Claassens

comments.text:
I dated a guy for a very short period of time and grew feelings for him, I 
really liked him which is rare for me these days. At first, I was so sure 
that he liked me back because he said so from the very beginning, yet 
he changed drastically within a week and I felt completely unimportant to 
him, he stopped caring. One night when he was rude for no good reason, I 
walked back packed my stuff and left for the train station but I couldn't 
get on the train. I sat there for hours and then eventually texted him... 
and he was rude telling me I shouldn't crawl back which made me feel 
absolutely miserable. He picked me up and took me home and afterwards we 
slept miles apart. I explained why I left, he didn't really care for that 
either. We walked to the train station the next morning, ignoring the 
entire incident. He walked me to the right platform and kissed me goodbye. 
I feel heartbroken.. and stupid and confused. I don't understand what 
happened.﻿
comments.author: tantenettie

comments.text:

said his life is going by to fast and he didn't want to rush into things, 
and then an hour later he started dating this girl he had hung out with for 
like a month. And better yet, he still wanted to be friends. ﻿

comments.author: Fab ram

comments.text:
I am proud to sat that the only time I have broken up with a girl I handled 
it very well and as comfortingly as possible (and without being 
disingenuous) It was very easy to be honest with her because I stilled 
cared about her immensely. Our relationship had become stagnant for many 
unknown reasons but it had. Because I still cared about her so much I ended 
things as empathetical and as affectionate as I could. I care about this 
girl to this day and will for the remainder of my life.
The reason that this worked out so smoothly and painlessly for both of us 
was because even through the breakup I still cared about her. I am very 
particular about dating people and consequentially was surprised that I 
fell for this girl (especially as early as high school) But nonetheless I 
knew I loved her and went with it. It was because of my particularity for 
relationships that saved us both from maddening heart ache as so many 
people have experienced.
My life experience screams to me to be as sure as you possibly can when 
getting seriously involved with another person. If you do this I guarantee 
you that it will work out better for you and your partner, regardless of if 
you stay together for life or for a few months.﻿
comments.author: Gabriel Thompson

comments.text:

comments.text:
+D3NlS5E It IS traumatic... like there is a before and an after... but 
honestly I don't find much benefits... except that I don't really care 
about having a girlfriend anymore, and that the girlfriends I had after 
were not really important for me. It's a major loss of innocence, now I am 
very cynical about life, and have a mild hate for the other gender. I miss 
my old-self sometimes.

comments.text:
+Simonthecat88 Sounds like an interesting thing to experience, like

comments.author: Devin

comments.text:
Really ?!?... you have absolutely no idea how this is painful.
When you realize that you don't exist anymore in the eyes of the person you 
still love it's just like a never ending sucker punch... you just can't 
breath fully and eating is a torture. And the more you loved the person... 
the more this sensation lasts... and good luck to trust someone after this.
I hope you'll find a person that you will love and that will love you in 
return... like really I don't wish to be heartbroken to ANYBODY... except 
"this" girl.
comments.author: Simonthecat88

comments.text:
Wow these women are totally devoid of logic.
My gf and I have been dating for 4 years now. I don't get really "excited" 
to see her like the women in 2:50 mentioned. I look forward to seeing and 
being with her but since I see her almost every day, I think it'd be weird 
if I got excited.

And the girl at 3:10 (who had a 4 year relat.) didn't discuss her problems 
with her boyfriend = breakup. We NEVER tolerate each other's problems. We 
always solve whatever is bothering us. Thus we never have fights and we're 
really happy together.

When you are in a long relationship, it becomes like you are sexually 
attracted to the BEST friend you've ever had in your entire life. I started 
feeling this after 2 years of our relationship. I don't think most of these 
people have been in a real relationship.﻿
comments.author: Kazathul

comments.text:
'When somebody doesn't like you for you, then it's over.' - Never were 
truer words spoken. Don't waste your time on someone who just wants a 
partner, you want to be with someone who wants YOU.﻿

comments.author: Laetitia Stanic

comments.text:
I'm sorry but can i say that I fucking Love this! I don't there's something 
really awesome about seeing how real this gets. A lot of times people can 
put up these fronts of casual so that when they talk about something they 
love or are passionate about they tend to downplay it to what they think 
are acceptable levels. But when you get them to remember something painful 
that facade just crumbles and they are visible trying to put that front up 
but its so obvious how much these experiences stick with you. I don't know 
its just refreshing seeing genuine human emotion (even when the 
participants aren't willing)﻿

comments.text:
The worst breakup I had was recently when I was  trying to dump a rebound I 
was hooking up with for about a month. He was really creepy, shaved his 
entire body, hated all sports besides golf, & was super liberal and 
pretentious about everything he did. So I basically broke up via text but 
he kept responding so I pretended I was drunk and said I wanted to have his 
babies & we should get married & he stopped replying after that. I haven't 
seen him since Valentine's day. ﻿
comments.author: June Beauregard

comments.text:
I just broke up with my (now) ex. I felt guitly all the time, because I 
knew he loved me, but my feelings vanished over the last weeks and I knew 
this wouldn't be fair anymore, if he was the only one with feelings. I 
wasn't excited anymore to see or text him, even though I knew he was a very 
sweet guy. After I sent him this long message, trying to be polite and 
explaining everything, I agreed to meet one more time, because I owed him 
that. I think his broken-hearted look in his eyes will haunt me forever. It 
was a really good time with him, we were honest about our relationship, but 
when I started lying about certain things, I knew it shouldn't be anymore. 
I never thought that I would be the one to dump the other person in my 
first relationship. Still feeling bitter about hurting him that way.﻿
comments.author: yui7star

comments.text:
All I got from this was. 

If I got dumped, I feel bad.

I feel bad when I dump someone.

Question:When should relationship end.
Answer: Whenever I feel not excited I end it but the GF or BF is still 
trying to make this relationship better or currently at his or her worse 
time.

My question is,
Why not trying to make the spark light up again ?
Every relationship cools down after honeymoon period is over.
Try harder instead of giving up whenever you feel board after the 
excitement is over.
Don't expect people to give excitement every second of the relationship, it 
is just pure pressure that is being put on the person.

This is both for male and female who are easily feel boring in a 
relationship.

﻿
comments.author: ataiwanese

comments.text: I got heartbroken over this one guy and we weren't even daiting...﻿
comments.author: Wolf 07

comments.text:
My story is me and him never "officially" dated but he would flirt with me. 
As in bring stuff up from the past and tease me about it. I caught him 
staring at me a few times and he tries to make me jealous whenever he 
possibly can honestly. I thought he had felt mutual and I was waiting for 
him to make his move and ask me out. Well turns out he knew I had liked him 
for three months and he didn't tell me he didn't feel a thing for me. All 
humans ask for is the ounce of courtesy of someone saying "hey sorry I 
don't feel the same way" or that you tell them you do! And long story short 
: we aren't friends anymore and he still does the same old shit he's been 
doing for a year (staring, making me jealous, etc.) 😖﻿

comments.author: Slender Dodger

comments.text:
Best to know the traits of type 1 sociopaths in order to NOT get hurt and 
played. They love to play with you..hurt you.. use you...They have no 
conscience, therefore cannot feel love, empathy, guilt, and remorse, They 
are everywhere. They may be your friend who steals your 
boyfriend/significant other, your coworker who steals your ideas, your 
boyfriend/significant other who cheats on you, your difficult boss or 
teacher, etc.  Good to know the traits as you probably have at least one in 
your life right now... secretly jealous of you... secretly wishing you 
fail, gossiping about you behind your back.  If you date them... they make 
you feel like you're the most important person in the world- they mirror 
you in order to make you feel like they "get you!" - Their goal is to get 
into your psyche, in order to later play you- cheat on you- belittle 
you-control you... it's fun for them to hurt others emotionally. Good to 
know the traits of the type 1 sociopath as you probably have T least one in 
your life right now..AND if you are single, good to know, so you don't get 
played. Good to know if you have children, to prevent them from being 
harmed.﻿

comments.author: Ulquiorra Cifer

comments.text:
You have to ask her when the coast is clear from idiots or at least when 
the idiots are occupied for awhile. And don't snap, it's kind of weird. The 
first thing you do is find a common interest so you have something to talk 
about. Wait until you can get close up to her, like on the bus(if you ride 
the bus) try to sit near her. Or if your in the halls and you spot her on 
your way to class, you should go up next to her and say hi. Next you ask if 
she has read any book, played any video game, or watched nay movie that you 
like. For example, "Hey, have you seen the new episode of blah blah" or 
"have you ever read blah blah". It depends on how slow you want the process 
to go. If you just want to go up to her and get it over with without making 
some long plan you can do that too, this is just what I would do. btw, I'm 
like 13 so you might not want to take some of my advice.

that you like her it's going to change her perspective on you in a good 
way. Considering this girl is not just a stupid popular(for all I know), I 
think she would be flattered if anyone took the time to think about her and 
was asking people on youtube how to talk to her. I would just go for it

not confident in how you want to do it, than you will not come off as the 
best person you can be. Hope I helped and I wish you good luck young sir!

comments.author: Ulquiorra Cifer

comments.text:
Well, as I stated in the beginning of my first reply, I'm 51 years old.

What I didn't say was that I've never dated anybody longer than 9 months, 
I've only dated 2 women that could have turned into something serious 
enough to count as something serious (the first was when I was 19 the 2nd 
was when I was 43).

When I was in high school back in the early 80s the rampant teenage 
pregnancy problem that overwhelmed the high school age population of the 
country in the 1990s was just coming into fruition. Those teenagers from 
back them are now "wising up" their children to move slower in their 
relationships so that todays teenagers are a lot less promiscuous.

Because of that, women that are over high school age are now paying a lot 
more attention to what the guy can offer them "down the road". If you do 
some research into it you'll find that people are starting to marry less 
often, marry later in life, and stay single for longer periods of time 
between one relationship and another.

I've seen a number of people get into relationships that lasted less than 
10 years simply because they got together too young, or they lasted less 
than 20 years because now that a few children have been born (I have never 
had any children or even gotten a woman pregnant at all) the parents lost 
their chances to "do with their life what they wanted to do" because the 
children came along to early.

Anyway, just look through your old yearbooks, or stand at the window of an 
unoccupied classroom at the end of the day to see where she's going, or pay 
attention to whom she hangs around with, or go to some of the events that 
you know she's going to, etc. etc. etc.

You don't have to make contact with her just yet if you don't think you 
have a chance, but keep tabs on her as much as you can (without looking 
like creepy stalky guy) until you can make an advance towards her that she 
would be willing to understand is real. It doesn't have to be in high 
school. Hell, do some research about what percentage of people ever marry 
their high school sweetheart.
comments.author: Buford Pusser

comments.text:
I got dumped on my 16 birthday because I wouldn't give up my virginity to 
my boyfriend so he decided I didn't deserve a boyfriend or a present 
because I was a cold fish. I dumped my ex at 23 and moved all my stuff out 
of our apartment within 24 hours because of "womens intuition" he had been 
having sex with my best-friend and had been leaving her alone in our 
apartment where she had proceeded to steal my jewelry and cloths, I still 
find that bitches shirts in my unpacked clothing to this day and give it to 
goodwill. I had a boyfriend from 20 to 22 who was a drug addict, and I 
dumped him after I watched him snort a line of cocaine, I had known he 
smoked weed but, I didn't know what a drug addict looked like because they 
really don't describe to you in school the tendency I can't describe the 
feeling of seeing someone do cocaine but it sorta of feels like watching 
someone morph into a creature from your nightmares.  Each one sucked and I 
felt bad and gutted with each one, getting dumped and dumping someone feel 
the same to me. With each break up I actually saw red, and heard buzzing in 
my head which I found out is somthing called emotional cracks where the 
brain shuts down to avoid the overload of emotions. But it's okay ladies 
don't stay with people like that, and maybe being a girlfriend is not the 
right thing for everyone I have stopped calling people my "boyfriend" 
because the word sounds gross in my mouth. ﻿
